msDesc.head: Richard of Wallingford, astronomy, etc.; England, 14th century, middle or second half

msItem.author: Johannes Harlebeke (?)
msItem.title: Sphaera solida siue astrolabium sphericum
msItem.rubric: In nomine Domini, incipit Tractatus de Spera Solida, sive de Astrolabio Sperico, conpositus anno Domini. Mº. 13º.
msItem.incipit: Tocius astrologie speculacionis radix et fundamentum ejus, ejusque prolixitatis inmensitas
msItem.explicit: Nunc autem geometricas utilitates que ex cordis sumuntur dicemus.

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de mediis conjunctionibus et opposicionibus, et eclipsibus solis et lune.
msItem.incipit: Inter omnes stellarum errancium conjuncciones.

msItem.author: Richard of Wallingford
msItem.title: Exafrenon prognosticationum temporum
msItem.incipit: Ad perfectam noticiam judiciorum artis astrologie que natura regulante ex effectibus planetarum oriuntur

listBibl.bibl: J. D. North, Richard of Wallingford (1976), I, 179-243, II, 83-126, III, 17.

msItem.title: Astrology
msItem.rubric: De naturalibus effectibus planetarum
msItem.incipit: Nota quod omnis planeta proicit radios sue virtutis sperice
msItem.explicit: que necessario disponent secunda hujus predicia
msItem.note: Contains rubrics: “Prima regula de pluvia. Hec est tabula puteorum. De gelu et nive et grandine. De tonitruo. De terre motu. De stellis in aere apparentibus.” Apparently one text.

msItem.title: Astrology
msItem.incipit: Debilitas stellarum est casus. Exicium exilium
msItem.explicit: Dicuntur planete se respicere ... respiciat res adjudicabitur.

msItem.author: Roger of Hereford
msItem.title: De iudiciis astronomiae
msItem.rubric: De introduccione in Judicia Astrologie
msItem.incipit: Quoniam regulas artis astronomice judicandi non nisi per diversa opera dispersas invenimus
msItem.explicit: et per sextam duodecimam patebit. Explicit.
msItem.note: Imperfect? The final rubric is “De secunda domorum distinccione”

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.rubric: Ad proiciendum eclipsim solis
msItem.incipit: Primo accipiatur vera hora conjuncconis

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.incipit: Ad sciendum latitudinem stelle ab equinoxiali

listBibl.bibl: Printed North, I, 433, as an unfinished tract tentatively attributed to Richard of Wallingford.

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.rubric: Ad hanc tabulam intra cum latitudine lune ...

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.rubric: Tabula motus octave spere

msItem.author: Māshāʼallāh
msItem.title: De compositione astrolabii
msItem.incipit: Sciendum quod astrolabium sit nomen Grecum cujus interpretacio est accepcio stellarum
msItem.explicit: hoc modo facies ceteras latitudines regionis ejusdem tabule si Deus voluerit
msItem.finalRubric: Finit opus astrolabii secundum Marcellania benedictus Deus amen.

msItem.author: Māshāʼallāh
msItem.title: De compositione astrolabii
msItem.rubric: Nomina instrumentorum astrolabii hec sunt.
msItem.incipit: Primum est armilla suspensoria
msItem.explicit: talis est comparacio stature tue ad totam planiciem

msItem.title: On the new quadrant
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatum Novi Quadrantis. Ars et operacio novi quadrantis editi a magistro Prefacio Judeo Martiliensis. Operis utilitate et faccionis facilitate omnia instrumenta ut dicit in prologo suo excedentis exposita a Petro de Adamaro Parisius diligenter correcti et perfecti.
msItem.incipit: Accipe igitur tabulam eream
msItem.explicit: Et multe sunt conclusiones que sciri non poterunt per hoc instrumentum que non dum sunt invente
msItem.note: Not the work of Petrus de Sancto Audomaro; North, II, 313 tentatively attributed the text to John Maudith.
Tables of longitude and latitude at fols. 58—59.

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.rubric: Generalis doctrina ad inveniendum quamlibet equacionem cujuslibet argumenti
msItem.incipit: Quando oportet intrare bis in aliquam tabulam

listBibl.bibl: North, II, 314 ("instructions for using tables of the equation of the argument")

msItem.author: Richard of Wallingford
msItem.title: Tractatus horologii astrologii
msItem.incipit: Prima conclusio habita rota certi numeri dencium equalium

listBibl.bibl: North, I, 443-526; II, 309-370; III, 61-74. North's edition does not follow the order of the manuscript: for details see the table in II, 320.

msItem.author: Richard of Wallingford
msItem.title: Tractatus horologii astrologii
msItem.rubric: Tabula proporcionis dividens circulum habentem. .360. partes equales in quotlibet alias partes equales infra .400. partes pro rotis horoogii et aliorum instrumentorum

msItem.author: William Rede
msItem.title: Tabulae Oxonienses cum canonibus
msItem.incipit: In nomine domini nostri Jesu Cristi. Volentibus futuros effectus planetarum in istis inferioribus pronosticare
msItem.explicit: [Conclusio septima] dico igitur in hoc casu quod Scorpion. 10. ga .21. ma. est ascendens et cetera

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.rubric: Ars componendi tabulam diversitatis aspectus in quovis climate
msItem.incipit: Prima linea que est linea numeri continebit omnes koras equales
msItem.explicit: et nota hoc pro opere subtilissimo

listBibl.bibl: See North, II, 314 ("ostensibly a precis of Albategni's third chapter")

msItem.title: Tables
msItem.finalRubric: Per istas tabulas debent dividi omnes rote pertinentes ad instrumentum de motibus omnium planetarum

msItem.title: 'Triangulus rectangulus'
msItem.incipit: Fiat triangulus rectangulus quod est triangulus. adc. Alterum quadratum est
msItem.explicit: et exibit idem scilicet. 54. et cetera.

msItem.author: Richard of Wallingford
msItem.title: Albion
msItem.incipit: Albion est geometricum instrumentum Almanac autem arsmetricum: utrumque tamen eisdem artibus licet inparibus adinventum
msItem.rubric: (fol. 129.) Incipit secunda pars Albionis
(fol. 141.) Incipit pars tercia de modo operandi per instrumentum
(fol. 150.) Explicit pars tercia tractatus Albionis. Incipit pars quarta Albionis adjecta pro errore vitando in compositione

listBibl.bibl: Richard of Wallingford, ed. North, I, 245-401, II, 127-286, III, 19-51, 75-107.

msItem.author: Richard of Wallingford
msItem.title: Tractatus rectanguli
msItem.rubric: Prologus in artem componendi Instrumentum Rectangulum
msItem.incipit: Rectangulum in remedium tediosi et diffcilis operis armillarum eodem tempore quo composuimus Albion. hoc est sub annis Christi .1326. concepimus ad rectificandum
msItem.rubric: Explicit ars componendi rectangulum. Incipit ars operandi cum illo. Prefacio.
msItem.incipit: Rectangulus omnium circulorum
msItem.explicit: quia eciam per ea que jam dicta sunt sufficienter docili discipulo patet via ad omnia ea que per cetera instrumenta sciri possunt ponimus hie finem. si Deus voluerit amen
msItem.note: Followed by an alphabet, and the verse (containing all letters) “Equore cum gelido zephirus fert exennia kymbus.”

listBibl.bibl: Richard of Wallingford, ed. North, I, 403-432, II, 287-308, III, 53-8.

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.incipit: Cum habueris tabulam stellarum fixarum factam ad longitudinem
msItem.explicit: et iste est modus curtissimus verificandi stellas secundum astronomos subtiles et sapientes. Explicit.

listBibl.bibl: Text on celestial coordinates, printed North, I, 433-6, with discussion II, 302-305, tentatively attributed to Richard of Wallingford.

msItem.author: Richard of Wallingford
msItem.title: Tractatus horologii astrologii
msItem.rubric: Pro compositione motus solis in rotis
msItem.incipit: Inicium operis est ut operarius habeat tabulam proporcionis
msItem.explicit: per Ovidium, Principium capiunt Phebus et annus idem

listBibl.bibl: Richard of Wallingford, ed. North, I, 247-401 and II, 309-370, with description of the manuscript at II, 310-315. North's edition does not follow the order of the manuscript: for details see the table in II, 320.

msItem.author: Thebit ben Corat
msItem.title: De hiis quae indigent expositione antequam legitur Almagestum
msItem.rubric: Liber quem edidit Tebit filius Chord de hijs que indigent expositione antequam legatur
msItem.incipit: Equator did est circulus major

msItem.author: Richard of Wallingford
msItem.title: Tractatus horologii astrologii
msItem.incipit: Memorandum quod si sol in .32. diebus pertranseat. 29. dentes de circulo

listBibl.bibl: Richard of Wallingford, ed. North, I, 247-401 and II, 309-370, with description of the manuscript at II, 310-315. North's edition does not follow the order of the manuscript: for details see the table in II, 320.

msItem.title: Phlebotomy
msItem.rubric: Proprietates signorum
msItem.incipit: Aries: cave ab incisione in capite

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.incipit: Cognito vero gradu stelle in ecliptica et latitudine ejus ab ecli[p]tica, docet Tholomeus in. 8º. libro almagesti capº. 5to. cognosces gradum cum quo Stella mediat celum et latitudinem ejus ab ecliptica, per unam demonstracionem que presupponit noticiam demonstracionis de cathio quam ponit in. 12º. capº, primo libro almagesti. Ponam igitur in primo capo Tholomeum de verbo ad verbum, set ubi inveneris aliquam litteram subtractam scias illam esse glosam liniarem ejusdem textus.

listBibl.bibl: Text on celestial coordinates, printed North, I, 436-7, with discussion II, 305-307, attributed tentatively to Richard of Wallingford.

msItem.note: Blank, except for decorative strapwork initials added later.
Blank, except for decorative strapwork initials and drawings added later.

msItem.title: Astronomy
msItem.incipit: Si habueris declinacionem alicujus stelle a circulo equinoxiali faciliter et certe investigare poteris latitudinem ejusdem stelle a via solis que ecliptica dicitur, per demonstracionem Geber in fine libri sui

listBibl.bibl: Text on celestial coordinates, printed North, I, 438-9, with discussion II, 307-308, attributed tentatively to Richard of Wallingford.

msItem.rubric: Tabula veri motus solis in anno bisextili
Tabule ad domificandum, sive ad reducendum celum in duodecim partes pro figura judiciali. Deo gracias

msItem.note: Later notes on the preceding table.
Blank, except for decorative strapwork initials added later, and a 16th-century recipe.

msItem.title: Diagrams of instruments
msItem.rubric: Figura lilii et armille suspensorie ...

supportDesc.condition: Lower outer corner of most leaves damaged.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in ink for 1 col., c. 32-36 lines; ruled space c. 140-150 c. 85-100

decoDesc.decoNote: Penwork initials and borders (generally blue initials flourished red).
Sketches of initials added 15th century - 16th century, fols. 183r-184v etc.
Drawings added 15th century - 16th century, fols. 188v (bird) etc.

binding.p: Medieval binding with remains of clasp; rebacked.

history.origin:
14th century, middle or second half; additions, 15th century–16th century
English
history.provenance: St Albans, Hertfordshire, Benedictine abbey of St Alban: 'Hic est liber sancti Albani' (fol. 108v), 'Liber subsacrista sancti Albani quondam fratris Iohannis Loukyn' (fol. 160r) (MLGB3: evidence from an ex-libris inscription or note of gift to an institution). For John Loukyn see North, II, 311-312. Possibly also written at St Albans as the manuscript (according to North, esp. II, 310-320) draft texts by Richard of Wallingford.
“Ex dono Thomæ Barton de Middleton alias Milton juxta Sittingbourne in com: Cant: gen.” (front pastedown)
history.acquisition: Bequeathed by him to the Ashmolean Museum; transferred to the Bodleian Library in 1860.

recordHist.source:
Description adapted by Matthew Holford (May 2025) from the following sources, with additional reference to published literature as cited and limited additional description. Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, III (1973), no. 752 W. H. Black, A descriptive, analytical, and critical catalogue of the manuscripts bequeathed unto the University of Oxford by Elias Ashmole Esq...., Quarto Catalogues X, 1845
Quarto Catalogue, cols. 1505–6 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 1507–8 Quarto Catalogue, col. 1509 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 1092

ref.title: MLGB3: Medieval Libraries of Great Britain

revisionDesc.change: Incorporate all information from printed catalogue, with reference to published literature, limited additional description; MS. seen.
